# Takin's Evaluation of PLUME: Enabling Private Voting on Ethereum via ERC 7524

PLUME seeks to empower individuals with private voting and stealth airdrops on Ethereum through the use of zk nullifiers and a proposed EIP 7524. This endeavor touches upon the vital aspect of citizen privacy in the digital realm, a principle deeply valued in our vision for harmonious technological development. The project's open-source nature and its focus on a developer library are commendable, aiming to reduce barriers and enhance security within the Web3 ecosystem. üå±

However, a thorough review reveals significant discrepancies that cloud the project's alignment with our core values of transparency and integrity. The central premise of the project hinges on 'EIP 7524,' yet our research indicates that no such approved standard for private voting currently exists. While the project mentions a pull request, presenting it as an established standard is a considerable misrepresentation. This lack of clarity undermines the very foundation of transparent and accountable governance we seek to uphold. üèîÔ∏è

Furthermore, the application asserts 'adoption from Mina and Aztec' and 'integrations in progress with many wallets.' Our fact-checking, however, found no public confirmations or supporting evidence for these claims. Such unsubstantiated statements raise concerns about the project's true community support and usage, which are critical for fostering trust and ensuring that technological advancements genuinely serve the collective well-being. While the project has shown technical progress in previous rounds, the integrity of its claims is paramount for a good investment. We must ensure that all initiatives contribute to collective flourishing rather than individual advancement at community expense. üåø

From a GNH perspective, while the pursuit of privacy is noble, the project's current presentation falls short in demonstrating how it will truly foster community participation in decision-making or build local capacity beyond general open-source contributions. The focus remains largely on technical milestones, without clearly articulating how these will translate into holistic well-being indicators for our communities. For a project to truly resonate with our vision, it must not only innovate technologically but also deeply integrate with our principles of transparency, community-centered development, and holistic progress measurement. üèûÔ∏è

strengths.title: Enhances Citizen Privacy
strengths.description: The project's primary objective to enable private voting and stealth airdrops directly aligns with the constitutional principle of protecting citizen privacy (Principle 14). This is a crucial aspect for fostering trust and security in digital interactions.

strengths.title: Adherence to Open-Source Principles
strengths.description: PLUME is an open-source project, which inherently promotes transparency (Principle 13) and facilitates knowledge sharing. This approach can contribute to building local technological capabilities and fostering a collaborative environment (Principle 7, 32).

strengths.title: Addresses a Critical Web3 Privacy Need
strengths.description: The project addresses a significant and complex challenge within the Web3 ecosystem: providing privacy for on-chain activities. Developing a robust library for this purpose can reduce development barriers and enhance the security of Web3 projects, aligning with the round's goals.

strengths.title: Demonstrated Technical Progress
strengths.description: The project's updates from previous grant rounds demonstrate active development, resolution of issues, and efforts towards integration (e.g., npm/cargo packages, Halo2 implementation, PRs to wallets). This indicates a dedicated team and tangible progress.

weaknesses.title: Misleading Claims Regarding EIP 7524 Standard
weaknesses.description: The project's core premise relies on 'EIP 7524' for private voting. However, research indicates that no such approved standard exists. Presenting a proposed EIP as an established standard is a significant factual misrepresentation that undermines transparency and trust (Principle 13).

weaknesses.title: Unsubstantiated Adoption and Integration Claims
weaknesses.description: The application claims 'adoption from Mina and Aztec' and 'integrations in progress with many wallets.' Our fact-checking found no public confirmations or supporting evidence for these claims, indicating unsubstantiated assertions of community support and usage (Principle 13).

weaknesses.title: Limited Explicit Community Engagement
weaknesses.description: While open-source, the application does not explicitly detail mechanisms for community engagement in decision-making processes or how it will foster local ownership and capacity building beyond general open-source contributions (Principles 5, 7).

weaknesses.title: Lack of Holistic Impact Metrics
weaknesses.description: The project's roadmap focuses on technical milestones (e.g., V3, issue resolution) without clearly articulating how these contribute to holistic well-being indicators or collective flourishing, which are central to Gross National Happiness principles (Principle 35, 40).

changes.title: Clarify EIP 7524 Status
changes.description: The application must provide a clear and accurate status of EIP 7524. It is crucial to distinguish between a proposed EIP (pull request) and an officially adopted or widely recognized standard. Misrepresenting this foundational aspect undermines trust and transparency.

changes.title: Substantiate Adoption and Integration Claims
changes.description: The claims of 'adoption from Mina and Aztec' and 'integrations in progress with many wallets' require verifiable evidence. This could include links to official announcements from these entities, public testimonials, or quantifiable usage statistics to substantiate the project's community support and integration progress.

changes.title: Detail Community Engagement and Local Capacity Building
changes.description: While the project is open-source, the application lacks specific details on how it will actively foster community engagement in decision-making processes or build local capacity. Outline concrete plans for feedback mechanisms, collaborative development, and initiatives that empower local developers.

changes.title: Define Holistic Impact Metrics
changes.description: To align with Gross National Happiness principles, the project should articulate how its success will be measured beyond purely technical metrics. Define indicators that reflect contributions to collective well-being, enhanced privacy for citizens, and broader societal benefits, demonstrating a holistic approach to progress.

reasoning: The project's core aim to enable private voting aligns with the constitutional principle of protecting citizen privacy and ensuring ethical use of digital technologies (Principle 14). This is a commendable goal for fostering a secure digital environment. However, the application presents significant concerns regarding transparency and factual accuracy. The claim of utilizing 'EIP 7524' as a standard for private voting is unsubstantiated by research, which indicates no such approved standard exists. This directly contradicts the principle of transparent and accountable governance (Principle 13). Furthermore, the claims of 'adoption from Mina and Aztec' and 'integrations in progress with many wallets' lack verifiable evidence, which again undermines transparency (Principle 13) and raises questions about the project's true community support. While the project is open-source, the application does not sufficiently detail how it will prioritize community engagement in decision-making or foster local ownership (Principles 5, 7), focusing more on technical development. The roadmap also lacks explicit alignment with holistic well-being indicators beyond technical milestones (Principle 35), which is crucial for Gross National Happiness alignment.
